page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: WHEN WENDY STICKELLS AND JUDITH BIRD INTERVIEWED THIS MAN HE WAS MOWING HIS LAWN.HE LIVES IN A CUL-DE-SAC CALLED HOWARDS CRESCENT,SO NAMED AFTER HENRY VIII'S 5TH WIFE,KATHERINE HOWARD WHOSE FAMILY OWNED THE AREA.THE BARN DATES BACK TO THAT TIME,AND IS MADE OF WOOD AND PEBBLES AND STONES WHICH YOU COULD NOT DRILL INTO,WITH THE ORIGINAL SUPPORT BEAMS,THE REST BEING REPAIRED.ACROSS THE ROAD IS ANOTHER COTTAGE CALLED "THE MIDDEN",BUT NOT QUITE AS OLD.THE OTHER HOUSES WERE MORE MODERN.HE AND HIS WIFE REGRETTED THE LACK OF LOCAL FACILITIES FOR BOTH YOUNG AND OLD,ESPECIALLY LIBRARIES AND WALKING AREAS.THEY ARE RETIRED AND HAVE LIVED THERE FOR 10 YEARS. IN HIS PORCH HE HAD HUNG A MACE,WHICH IS A ROUND SPIKED BALL CHAINED TO A CARRYING STICK.IT WAS USED IN BATTLE IN MEDIEVAL TIMES
